mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.blocks.I.name: IScriptTileEntity

asMinecraft.docs:
Get Minecraft tile entity instance

BEWARE: You need to know the MCP mappings to directly call methods on this instance!

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.blocks.I.name: IScriptBlockState

asMinecraft.docs:
Get Minecraft block state instance

BEWARE: You need to know the MCP mappings to directly call methods on this instance!

isOpaque.docs: Returns true if the block state occupies the full block and is not transparent

hasCollision.docs:
Checks if the block state has collision boxes at a given position

Collision shape may differ depending on the world and coordinates

isAir.docs: Checks if this block state is air

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.data.ISc.name: IScriptBox

isColliding.docs: Checks if this box collides with another.

contains.docs:
Checks if given coordinates are inside of this box 

{@code
 function main(c)
 {
     var box = mappet.box(-10, 4, -10, 10, 6, 10);
     c.send(box.contains(0, 4, 0)) // true
     c.send(box.contains(0, 7, 0)) // false
 }
 }

{@code
 function main(c)
 {
     var box = mappet.box(-10, 4, -10, 10, 6, 10);
     var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition()
     if (box.contains(pos)){
         c.send("Subject is inside the box")
     }
 }
 }

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.entities.name: IScriptPlayer

asMinecraft.docs: Get Minecraft player entity instance. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings to directly call methods on this instance!

return.docs: Whether player is an operator
Player's game mode as an integer, 0 is survival, 1 is creative, 2 is adventure, and 3 is spectator.

parameters.name: gameMode
parameters.docs: Player's game mode 0 is survival, 1 is creative, 2 is adventure, and 3 is spectator.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.docs: Whether the player can fly or not.

setHotbarIndex.docs: Set forcefully player's current hotbar inventory index. Acceptable values are 0 - 8.

parameters.name: source
parameters.docs: Source of skin data

return.docs: url – URL to the player's skin texture, slim – boolean indicating if the model is Alex
url – URL to the player's skin texture, slim – boolean indicating if the model is Alex

parameters.name: fadeIn
parameters.docs: How many ticks it will take for title and subtitle to appear.

parameters.name: idle
parameters.docs: For how many ticks will title and subtitle stay after fading in.

parameters.name: fadeOut
parameters.docs: How many ticks it will take for title and subtitle to disappear after idling.

sendActionBar.docs: Send a message to this player that will be displayed in the action bar. The duration of action bar line is 60 ticks (3 seconds).

parameters.name: level
parameters.docs: Experience level.

parameters.name: points
parameters.docs: Number of experience points in that particular level.

parameters.name: points
parameters.docs: Number of experience points to add to player.

getXpPoints.docs: Get player's experience points in their current level.

getModsList.docs: Returns array of mods on the client [id:version]

stopSound.docs:
Stop specific sound event in given sound category for this player.

For list of sound categories, type into chat /playsound minecraft:entity.pig.ambient, press space, and press Tab key. The list of sounds categories will be displayed.

{@code
    c.getWorld().stopSound("minecraft:entity.pig.ambient", "master");
 }

closeUI.docs:
Close the user interface.

You can use this method to close any GUI that player has opened, inventory, chests, command block menu, Mappet dashboard, etc. However, Mappet won't close the in-game pause menu (to avoid potential griefing).

getUIContext.docs:
Get the UI context of currently opened user UI. See {@link IMappetUIContext}
 for code examples.

parameters.name: id
parameters.docs: HUD scene's ID/filename.

setupHUD.docs: Setup (initiate) an HUD scene for this player.

parameters.name: id
parameters.docs: HUD scene's ID/filename.

parameters.name: index
parameters.docs: Index of the morph in the scene that should be changed (0 is the first and so on).

changeHUDMorph.docs: Change a morph in a HUD scene at given index with given morph.

parameters.name: id
parameters.docs: HUD scene's ID/filename.

closeHUD.docs: Close specific HUD scene for this player.

parameters.name: sceneName
parameters.docs: Scene's ID.

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.entities.name: IScriptNpc

asMinecraft.docs:
Get Mappet entity NPC instance. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings in order to directly call methods on this instance!

But some methods might have human readable method names. Please check EntityNpc class for methods that don't have {@link Override} annotation!

parameters.name: stateId
parameters.docs: state ID

parameters.name: canPickUpLoot
parameters.docs: true if NPC can pick up stuff, false otherwise

parameters.name: target
parameters.docs: Target to follow (can be a player name, @r)

getFaction.docs:
Returns the faction of the NPC as a string 
{@code
 c.send(c.getSubject().getFaction())
 }

parameters.name: size
parameters.docs: the new shadow size for the NPC.

return.docs: the shadow size of the NPC.

parameters.name: xp
parameters.docs: the new XP value for the NPC.

return.docs: the new XP value.
the XP value of the NPC.
the path distance of the NPC.

parameters.name: sightRadius
parameters.docs: the new path distance for the NPC.

parameters.name: sightDistance
parameters.docs: the new attack range for the NPC.

return.docs: the attack range of the NPC.

parameters.name: killable
parameters.docs: the new killable status for the NPC.

setKillable.docs:
Sets the killable status of the NPC. If false, then NPCs can be killed only by a command. Regardless of the state, killable allows to make this NPC damaged until 0 health. 
{@code
 c.getSubject().setKillable(true);
 }

return.docs: true if the NPC is killable, false otherwise.

isKillable.docs:
Gets the killable status of the NPC. If false, then NPCs can be killed only by a command. Regardless of the state, killable allows to make this NPC damaged until 0 health. 
{@code
 var isKillable = c.getSubject().isKillable();
 }

return.docs: true if the NPC can get burned, false otherwise.

parameters.name: canGetBurned
parameters.docs: the new burnable status for the NPC.

return.docs: true if the NPC can take fall damage, false otherwise.

parameters.name: canFallDamage
parameters.docs: the new status for the NPC's fall damage.

return.docs: the damage of the NPC.

parameters.name: damage
parameters.docs: the new damage for the NPC.

return.docs: the damage delay of the NPC.

parameters.name: damageDelay
parameters.docs: the new damage delay for the NPC.

return.docs: true if the NPC wanders, false otherwise.

parameters.name: wander
parameters.docs: the new wandering status for the NPC.

return.docs: true if the NPC looks around while idle, false otherwise.

parameters.name: lookAround
parameters.docs: the new idle look around status for the NPC.

return.docs: true if the NPC looks at the player, false otherwise.

parameters.name: lookAtPlayer
parameters.docs: the new status for the NPC's behavior to look at the player.

parameters.name: index
parameters.docs: index of the patrol point to be removed

parameters.name: x
parameters.docs: x coordinate

parameters.name: y
parameters.docs: y coordinate

parameters.name: z
parameters.docs: z coordinate

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.entities.name: IScriptEntityItem
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.entities.docs:
EntityItem interface.

This interface represents an item entity.

return.docs: how many ticks entity exists

parameters.name: age
parameters.docs: ticks

return.docs: How many ticks remains until someone can pick up this item

parameters.name: delay
parameters.docs: In ticks

return.docs: How many ticks remains until someone can pick up this item

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.docs: In ticks

return.docs: Nickname of player who can pick up this item.
Nickname of player who throw this item.

setDefaultPickupDelay.docs: Set's default pick up delay (10, actually).

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.entities.name: IScriptEntity

return.docs: The dimension of the entity as an integer.

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.docs: The dimension to teleport the entity to.

setDimension.docs:
Set the dimension of the entity. 
{@code
   c.getSubject().setDimension(1); // Teleport to The End
 }

getWidth.docs: Get entity's current hitbox width (and depth, it's the same number).

isOnGround.docs: Is this entity on the ground.

rayTrace.docs:
Ray trace from entity's looking direction (including any entity intersection).
 Check {@link IScriptRayTrace} for an example.

rayTraceBlock.docs:
Ray trace from entity's looking direction (excluding entities).
 Check {@link IScriptRayTrace} for an example.

getHelmet.docs:
Return the entity's helmet's item stack. 
{@code
   c.send( c.getSubject().getHelmet().serialize() )
 }

getChestplate.docs:
Return the entity's chestplate's item stack. 
{@code
   c.send( c.getSubject().getChestplate().serialize() )
 }

getLeggings.docs:
Return the entity's leggings' item stack. 
{@code
   c.send( c.getSubject().getLeggings().serialize() )
 }

getBoots.docs:
Return the entity's boots' item stack. 
{@code
   c.send( c.getSubject().getBoots().serialize() )
 }

playAnimation.docs:
Play an animation on this entity, (need ChameleonMorph) 
@code
     c.getSubject().playAnimation("running");

isAIEnabled.docs: Check whether entity's AI is enabled.

setAIEnabled.docs: Set entity's AI to be enabled or disabled (if it has it).

getId.docs: Get entity's resource location ID, like minecraft:pig or minecraft:zombie.

getTicks.docs: Get how many ticks did this entity existed.

getFullData.docs: Get entity's full (copy of its) NBT data.

setFullData.docs: Overwrite NBT data of this entity. WARNING: use it only if you know what are you doing as this method can corrupt entities.

getEntityData.docs:
Get Forge's custom tag compound in which you can story any data you want.

There is no setter method as you can directly work with returned NBT compound. Any changes to returned compound will be reflected upon entity's data.

isPlayer.docs: Check whether this entity is a player.

isNpc.docs: Check whether this entity is an NPC.

isNPC.docs: Check whether this entity is an NPC.

isItem.docs: Check whether this entity is an item.

isLivingBase.docs: Check whether this entity is living base.

isSame.docs: Check whether this entity is same as given entity.

damage.docs:
Inflict some damage on this entity (use {@link #kill()} to kill the entity though). 
{@code
 c.getSubject().damage(1); //dealt you 1 damage
 }

return.docs: the bounding box of this entity

setFallDistance.docs:
Set entity's fall distance.

You can use this method, by calling it with 0, to prevent fall damage when teleporting an entity which was already falling.

remove.docs: Remove this entity from the server without any dead effects (essentially despawn).

kill.docs: Kill this entity from the server by inflicting lots of damage (similar to /kill command).

parameters.name: arm
parameters.docs: 0 is primary (main), 1 is secondary (off-hand).

return.docs: leashed entities list

parameters.name: leashHolder
parameters.docs: the entity to leash this entity to

return.docs: whether the leash holder was set successfully
the leash holder of this entity

parameters.name: dropLead
parameters.docs: whether to drop the lead item

return.docs: whether the leash holder was cleared successfully

parameters.name: potion
parameters.docs: Potion that should be applied.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.docs: Duration of the effect in ticks (20 ticks = 1 second).

parameters.name: amplifier
parameters.docs: How strong is potion effect.

parameters.name: particles
parameters.docs: Whether potion effect's particles should be emitted.

return.docs: true if there was effect, and it was successfully removed, false if had no given effect present.
entity's states, or null if this entity doesn't have states.
if entity's morph was changed successfully.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.docs: For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.

parameters.name: rotate
parameters.docs: Whether attached world morph should replicate entity's rotation (i.e. copy head rotation).

parameters.name: morph
parameters.docs: Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).

parameters.name: expiration

parameters.name: pitch

parameters.name: rotate
parameters.docs: Whether attached world morph should replicate entity's rotation (i.e. copy head rotation).

parameters.name: morph
parameters.docs: Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.docs: For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.

parameters.name: yaw
parameters.docs: Horizontal rotation in degrees.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.docs: Vertical rotation in degrees.

parameters.name: rotate
parameters.docs: Whether attached world morph should replicate entity's rotation (i.e. copy head rotation).

parameters.name: player
parameters.docs: The player that only should see the morph, or null for everyone.

shootBBGunProjectile.docs:
Spawn a BB gun projectile. It works only if Blockbuster mod is present.

ProTip: To get the gun props' NBT code, configure a desired BB gun, and grab it into you main hand. Execute /item_nbt false command in the chat, paste the NBT into the script, and remove {Gun: in the beginning and a } in the end.

{@code
     c.getSubject().shootBBGunProjectile('{Gun:{Damage:1.0f,Projectile:{Meta:0b,Block:"minecraft:stone",Name:"block"},Gravity:0.0f}}')
 }

parameters.name: scriptName
parameters.docs: The name of the script to execute.

parameters.name: function
parameters.docs: The name of the function within the script to execute.

parameters.name: scriptName
parameters.docs: The name of the script to execute.

parameters.name: function
parameters.docs: The name of the function within the script to execute.

parameters.name: args
parameters.docs: The arguments to pass to the function.

parameters.name: x
parameters.docs: X position

parameters.name: y
parameters.docs: Y position

parameters.name: z
parameters.docs: Z position

parameters.name: yaw
parameters.docs: Yaw rotation

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.docs: Pitch rotation

parameters.name: yawHead
parameters.docs: Yaw rotation of the head

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.docs: The interpolation type used for the movement.

parameters.name: durationTicks
parameters.docs: The duration of the movement in ticks.

parameters.name: x
parameters.docs: The target x-coordinate for the entity.

parameters.name: y
parameters.docs: The target y-coordinate for the entity.

parameters.name: z
parameters.docs: The target z-coordinate for the entity.

moveTo.docs:
Moves the entity to the specified position (x, y, z) with the given interpolation type and duration. The following interpolation types are supported:

  • §7linear§r
  • §7quad_in§r
  • §7quad_out§r
  • §7quad_inout§r
  • §7cubic_in§r
  • §7cubic_out§r
  • §7cubic_inout§r
  • §7exp_in§r
  • §7exp_out§r
  • §7exp_inout§r
  • §7back_in§r
  • §7back_out§r
  • §7back_inout§r
  • §7elastic_in§r
  • §7elastic_out§r
  • §7elastic_inout§r
  • §7bounce_in§r
  • §7bounce_out§r
  • §7bounce_inout§r
  • §7sine_in§r
  • §7sine_out§r
  • §7sine_inout§r
  • §7quart_in§r
  • §7quart_out§r
  • §7quart_inout§r
  • §7quint_in§r
  • §7quint_out§r
{@code
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var pos = s.getPosition();
    s.moveTo("quad_out", 30, pos.x, pos.y+2, pos.z, false);
 }

parameters.name: entity
parameters.docs: The entity to observe

observe.docs:
Makes the entity observe the given entity. 
{@code
    c.getSubject().observe(null); //to stop observing
 }

parameters.name: shouldCirculate
parameters.docs: should the entity patrol the points in a loop

parameters.name: executeCommandOnArrival
parameters.docs: command to execute when the entity arrives at the point

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.IScriptR.name: IScriptRayTrace

getMinecraftRayTraceResult.docs: Get Minecraft ray trace result. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings in order to directly call methods on this instance!

isMissed.docs: Check whether this ray trace result didn't capture anything.

isBlock.docs: Check whether this ray trace result hit a block.

isEntity.docs: Check whether this ray trace result hit an entity.

getEntity.docs: Get entity that was captured by this ray trace result (it can be null).

getHitPosition.docs: Get precise position where it hit.

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.IScriptF.name: IScriptFactory

createCompoundFromJS.docs:
Turn a JS object into an NBT compound.

BEWARE: when converting JS object to NBT keeps in mind some limitations of the NBT format:

  • NBT supports multiple number storage formats (byte, short, int, long, float, double), so the converter will only be able to convert numbers to either integer or double NBT tags, depending on how did you get the number, 42 being an integer, and 42.0 being a double.
  • NBT lists support only storage of a single type at once, so if you provide an JS array like [0, 1, 2, "test", {a:1,b:2}, 4, [0, 0, 0], 5.5] then only the first element's type will be taken in the account, and the resulted NBT list will turn out like [0.0d, 1.0d, 2.0d, 4.0d, 5.5d]. In case with numbers if you had first integers, and somewhere in the middle of the list you got a double, then the integer type will get converted to double!
{@code
    var tag = mappet.createCompoundFromJS({id:"minecraft:diamond_hoe",Count:1});
    var item = mappet.createItemNBT(tag);

    // {id:"minecraft:diamond_hoe",Count:1b,Damage:0s}
    c.send(item.serialize());
 }

return.docs:
an item stack from the string NBT data, or an empty item stack

an item stack with block specified by ID, or an empty item
 stack if the block doesn't exist

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.IScriptE.name: IScriptEvent
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.IScriptE.docs:
Script event.

This interface represent the event, the only argument that was passed into script's function. It contains many different useful methods to interact with Minecraft on the server side.

getScript.docs: Get script's ID to which this event was passed to.

getSubject.docs: Get subject (primary) entity that was passed into the event.

getObject.docs: Get object (secondary) entity that was passed into the event.

getPlayer.docs: Get the first player from either subject or object (or null, if there is no player).

getNPC.docs: Get the first Mappet NPC from either subject or object (or null, if there is no NPC).

getWorld.docs: Get the world in which this event happened.

getServer.docs: Get the server in which this event happened.

getValues.docs: Get a map of extra context values that was passed into the event.

getValue.docs: Get a value for given key (might be a null).

get.docs: Get a value for given key (might be a null).

setValue.docs: Set a value for given key in extra data.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.docs: How many ticks should pass before scheduled script will be executed.

scheduleScript.docs:
Schedule a function (instead of script). Once the timer has expired,
 given function will be called with this context as the only argument.

return.docs:
How many successful commands were run. 0 - command errored, 1 - command was successful,
 2 or above - multiple commands were executed using target selectors.

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.items.IS.name: IScriptItemStack
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.items.IS.docs: This interface represents an item stack

asMinecraft.docs:
Get Minecraft item stack instance

BEWARE: You need to know the MCP mappings to directly call methods on this instance!

copy.docs: Get a copy of item stack.

hasData.docs: Check whether an item stack has an NBT compound tag.

getData.docs: Get item stack's NBT compound tag.

setData.docs: Replace item stack's NBT compound tag.

serialize.docs: Serialize item stack to an NBT compound.

getDisplayName.docs: Get display name of the item stack.

setDisplayName.docs: Set display name of the item stack.

getLore.docs: Get lore of the item stack.

getLoreList.docs: Get all lore lines of the item stack as a list.

setLore.docs: Set lore of the item stack.

addLore.docs: Add a lore line to the item stack.

clearAllLores.docs: Remove all lore lines from the item stack.

clearLore.docs: Remove a lore line from the item stack.

clearAllEnchantments.docs: Clear all enchantments from the item stack.

getCanDestroyBlocks.docs: Get a list of all blocks the item stack can destroy.

addCanDestroyBlock.docs: Add a block that the item stack can destroy.

clearAllCanDestroyBlocks.docs: Clear all blocks that the item stack can destroy.

clearCanDestroyBlock.docs: Clear a block that the item stack can destroy.

getCanPlaceOnBlocks.docs: Get a list of all blocks the item stack can place on.

addCanPlaceOnBlock.docs: Add a block that the item stack can place on.

clearAllCanPlaceOnBlocks.docs: Clear all blocks that the item stack can place on.

clearCanPlaceOnBlock.docs: Clear a block that the item stack can place on.

getRepairCost.docs: Get repair cost of the item stack.

setRepairCost.docs: Set repair cost of the item stack.

isUnbreakable.docs: Check if an item stack is unbreakable.

setUnbreakable.docs: Set whether an item stack is unbreakable or not.

add.docs: Add/remove more items to the stack.

equals.docs: Check if this item stack is equal to another item stack.

Get Minecraft item instance

BEWARE: You need to know the MCP mappings to directly call methods on this instance!

isSame.docs: Check whether given item is same as this one

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.nbt.INBT.docs: Interface that represents an NBT list tag

getInt.docs: Get integer (32-bit integer) value at given index

setInt.docs: Set integer (32-bit integer) value at given index

addInt.docs: Add integer (32-bit integer) value at the end of the list

getLong.docs: Get long (64-bit integer) value at given index

setLong.docs: Set long (64-bit integer) value at given index

addLong.docs: Add long (64-bit integer) value at the end of the list

getFloat.docs: Get float (32-bit floating point number) value at given index

setFloat.docs: Set float (32-bit floating point number) value at given index

addFloat.docs: Add float (32-bit floating point number) value at the end of the list

getDouble.docs: Get double (64-bit floating point number) value at given index

setDouble.docs: Set double (64-bit floating point number) value at given index

addDouble.docs: Add double (64-bit floating point number) value at the end of the list

getString.docs: Get string value at given index

setString.docs: Set string value at given index

addString.docs: Add string value at the end of the list

getBoolean.docs: Get boolean (true or false) value at given index

setBoolean.docs: Set boolean (true or false) value at given index

addBoolean.docs: Add boolean (true or false) value at the end of the list

getCompound.docs: Get NBT compound at given index

setCompound.docs: Set NBT compound at given index

addCompound.docs: Add NBT compound at the end of the list

getList.docs: Get NBT list at given index

setList.docs: Set NBT list at given index

addList.docs: Add NBT list at the end of the list

return.docs: an array of the list's elements

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.nbt.INBT.name: INBTCompound
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.nbt.INBT.docs: Interface that represents an NBT compound tag

asMinecraft.docs: Get raw NBT tag compound BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings to directly call methods on this instance!

has.docs: Check whether this NBT compound has a value by given key.

remove.docs: Remove a value by given key.

getByte.docs: Get byte (8-bit integer) value by given key.

setByte.docs: Set byte (8-bit integer) value by given key.

getShort.docs: Get short (16-bit integer) value by given key.

setShort.docs: Set short (16-bit integer) value by given key.

getInt.docs: Get integer (32-bit integer) value by given key.

setInt.docs: Set integer (32-bit integer) value by given key.

getLong.docs: Get long (64-bit integer) value by given key.

setLong.docs: Set long (64-bit integer) value by given key.

getFloat.docs: Get float (32-bit floating point number) value by given key.

setFloat.docs: Set float (32-bit floating point number) value by given key.

getDouble.docs: Get double (64-bit floating point number) value by given key.

setDouble.docs: Set double (64-bit floating point number) value by given key.

getString.docs: Get string value by given key.

setString.docs: Set string value by given key.

getBoolean.docs: Get boolean (true or false) value by given key.

setBoolean.docs: Set boolean (true or false) value by given key.

getCompound.docs: Get NBT compound by given key.

setCompound.docs: Set NBT compound by given key.

getList.docs: Get NBT list by given key.

setList.docs: Set NBT list by given key.

return.docs: Whether given NBT code was successfully inserted.

parameters.name: key
parameters.docs: the key of the value

return.docs: the value found by that key or null

parameters.name: compound
parameters.docs: the compound to compare with

return.docs: whether this compound is equal to the given compound

dumpJSON.docs:
Dumps to a JSON String. It first replaces the key-value colons with the proper JSON format. Then, it creates a pattern to match the desired numeric literals and boolean values. It checks if the current matched pattern is "0b" or "1b" and replaces them with "false" and "true" respectively. For the other cases, it removes the last character from the matched pattern, effectively removing the type literal. 
{@code
   var tag = mappet.createCompound("{id:\"minecraft:diamond_hoe\",Count:1b}");
   c.send(tag.dumpJSON());
 }

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.nbt.INBT.name: INBT
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.nbt.INBT.docs: Common interface for NBT data types.

isCompound.docs: Check whether this NBT data is an NBT compound.

isList.docs: Check whether this NBT data is an NBT list.

toString.docs: Convert this NBT structure to string.

isEmpty.docs: Check whether this NBT tag is empty.

size.docs: Get the size (amount of elements) in this NBT tag.

copy.docs: Create a copy of this NBT tag.

combine.docs: Add given NBT data's values on top of this one.

isSame.docs: Check whether given NBT tag is same as this one.

return.docs: team name
team color
visibility of player name tags in the team
visibility of death messages of players in the team
collision rule for players in a team
true if friendly fire is allowed, otherwise false
whether invisible players from the team are visible

parameters.name: color
parameters.docs: new team color

parameters.name: tagVisibility
parameters.docs: new visibility of player name tags in the team

parameters.name: deathMessageVisibility
parameters.docs: new visibility of player death messages in the team

parameters.name: collisionRule
parameters.docs: new collision rule for players in the team

parameters.name: allowFriendlyFire
parameters.docs: true to allow friendly fire, false to disallow it

parameters.name: seeFriendlyInvisibles
parameters.docs: true to make invisible players from the team visible, false to make them invisible

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.ui.IMapp.name: IMappetUIContext

getHotkey.docs:
Get the ID of the last pressed hot key.

If no keybind was pressed, it will be an empty string (""). See {@link UIComponent#keybind(int, String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean)} method for an example.

getContext.docs:
Get the ID of the last context menu item.

If no context menu was activated, it will be an empty string (""). See {@link UIComponent#context(String, String, String, int)} method for an example.

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.ui.IMapp.name: IMappetUIBuilder

getCurrent.docs:
Get current UI component on to which it adds children components.

It's useful only after using {@link IMappetUIBuilder#layout()}, {@link IMappetUIBuilder#column(int)}, {@link IMappetUIBuilder#row(int)}, and {@link IMappetUIBuilder#grid(int)} to being able to position layout element.

background.docs: Enable default background (subtle gradient of two half transparent dark colors).

parameters.name: closable
parameters.docs: Whether this UI screen can be closed or not (by default it is closable).

closable.docs: Toggle closability of this UI screen.

parameters.name: paused
parameters.docs: Whether this UI screen is paused when opened.

paused.docs: Toggle pausing of this UI screen.

parameters.name: id
parameters.docs: ID of desired component to be created.

Check {@link UIGraphicsComponent} for description and examples.

button.docs:

Check {@link UITextareaComponent} for description and examples.

Check {@link UITrackpadComponent} for description and examples.

Check {@link UIStringListComponent} for description and examples.

Check {@link UIStringListComponent} for description and examples.

item.docs:

parameters.docs:
Particle type, you can use {@link IScriptFactory#getParticleType(String)}
                     to get the desired particle type.

parameters.docs: Whether particles should be spawned regardless of the distance

parameters.docs: Z coordinate of position where particles should be spawned

parameters.name: n
parameters.docs: How many particles of given type should be spawned

parameters.docs: X random offset that shift particle relative to X coordinate where it spawned

parameters.name: dy
parameters.docs: Y random offset that shift particle relative to Y coordinate where it spawned

parameters.name: dz
parameters.docs: Z random offset that shift particle relative to Z coordinate where it spawned

parameters.name: speed
parameters.docs: The speed of particle, different particles might use this argument differently

parameters.name: args

Additional arguments that can be passed into a particle, for example for
                     "iconcrack" particle you can pass item numeric ID to spawn item particle for
                     a specific item (F3 + H shows the numeric ID of an item)

stopSound.docs:
Stop specific sound event in given sound category for every player.

For list of sound categories, type into chat /playsound minecraft:entity.pig.ambient, press space, and press Tab key. The list of sounds categories will be displayed.

{@code
    c.getWorld().stopSound("minecraft:entity.pig.ambient", "master");
 }

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.code.ui.UITra.name: UITrackpadComponent

value.docs: Set the value that of trackpad component.

min.docs: Set the minimum that this trackpad component can let the user pick.

max.docs: Set the maximum that this trackpad component can let the user pick.

integer.docs: Set this trackpad component to accept only whole numbers.

Toggle integer option, when passed true then this trackpad component will accept only whole numbers, and when passed false, then both whole and floating point numbers can be accepted by this trackpad.

limit.docs:
Convenience method that allows to set minimum and maximum, i.e. value range,
 that this trackpad field can accept.

Convenience method that allows to set minimum, maximum, and integer options
 that this trackpad field can accept.

amplitudes.docs: Changes the amplitudes of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much value changes when moving the cursor horizontally. Weak (Alt amplitude gets set 5 times weaker than input value, and strong (Shift) amplitude gets set 5 times stronger than input value.

parameters.name: normal
parameters.docs: Value change per pixel when no modifiers is held.

parameters.name: weak
parameters.docs: Value change per pixel when alt is held.

parameters.name: strong
parameters.docs: Value change per pixel when shift is held.

amplitudes.docs:
Changes the amplitudes of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much value changes when
 moving the cursor horizontally.

parameters.name: increment
parameters.docs: Value change per click on increment buttons.

increment.docs:
Changes the incremental value of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much being added
 or subtracted when user presses < and > buttons on the sides of the
 trackpad value.

Enables horizontal mode. This usable when {@link UILayoutComponent#scroll()}
 is enabled.

width.docs:
Per component width (in pixels) that should be sustained within
 {@link IMappetUIBuilder#grid(int)} layout type. This doesn't work with any other
 component than grid.

items.docs:
How many components per row that should be placed within
 {@link IMappetUIBuilder#grid(int)} layout type. This option doesn't work with
 any other component than grid.

gradient.docs: Draw a gradient rectangle relative to graphics component's frame.

image.docs:
Draw an image relative to graphics component's frame.

Image argument is a so called "resource location." For example, if you want to draw pig's skin on the screen you can input "minecraft:textures/entity/pig/pig.png" and it will draw it on the screen.

If you have Blockbuster enabled, it can also display images from internet by inputting image's URL. Although, sometimes it won't work due to incorrect headers that doesn't identify a web-browser.
Draw an image relative to graphics component's frame with known texture size.
Draw an image relative to graphics component's frame with known texture size and color.

parameters.name: color
parameters.docs: ARGB text's font color.

text.docs: Draw a text label relative to graphics component's frame.

parameters.name: anchorY

Draw a McLib icon relative to graphics component's frame.

Most of the icons are 16x16 so keep that in mind.

mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.code.ui.UICom.name: UIComponent
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.code.ui.UICom.docs:
Base UI component.

Every UI component in UI API is based off this base component, and therefore they have all of the methods available for changing ID, margins, frame (x, y, width, and height), tooltip, visibility, enabled, keybinds and update delay.

id.docs:
Set the ID of the component.

Without ID, the data that can be inputted by players won't be sent into the script handler, so it is required to set component's ID if you want to receive the data from the component.

BEWARE: multiple components must not share same ID, if they will it will certainly cause bugs in the data that you'll be receiving from the client and the way you retrieve components using {@link IMappetUIContext#get(String)}.

tooltip.docs: Set a tooltip that will be displayed at the bottom of component's frame.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.docs: 0 is bottom. 1 is top. 2 is right. 3 is left.

marginTop.docs:
Set top margin. See {@link #margin(int)} method for more information about
 restrictions.

marginBottom.docs:
Set bottom margin. See {@link #margin(int)} method for more information
 about restrictions.

marginLeft.docs:
Set left margin. See {@link #margin(int)} method for more information about
 restrictions.

marginRight.docs:
Set right margin. See {@link #margin(int)} method for more information about
 restrictions.

keybind.docs: Add a keybind with no modifiers. See {@link #keybind(int, String, String, boolean, boolean)} for proper example.

Add a keybind with optional Control modifier.
 See {@link #keybind(int, String, String, boolean, boolean)} for proper example.
Add a keybind with optional Control and/or Shift modifier(s).

parameters.name: icon
parameters.docs: Icon ID (see {@link UIIconButtonComponent}).

parameters.name: action
parameters.docs: Action ID that will be used for handling with {@link IMappetUIContext#getContext()}.

parameters.name: label
parameters.docs: Label that will be displayed in the context menu item.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.docs: Icon ID (see {@link UIIconButtonComponent}).

parameters.name: action
parameters.docs: Action ID that will be used for handling with {@link IMappetUIContext#getContext()}.

parameters.name: label
parameters.docs: Label that will be displayed in the context menu item.

parameters.name: color
parameters.docs: Background color highlight (in RGB hex format).

x.docs: Set X in pixels relative to parent component.

rx.docs: Set X relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully left, and 1 is fully right.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage how far into X.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

rx.docs: Set X relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully left, and 1 is fully right.

y.docs: Set Y in pixels relative to parent component.

ry.docs: Set Y relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully top, and 1 is fully bottom.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage how far into Y.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

ry.docs: Set Y relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully top, and 1 is fully bottom.

rw.docs: Set width relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's width, and 1 is 100% of parent's component width.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage of how wide relative to parent component.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

rw.docs: Set width relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's width, and 1 is 100% of parent's component width.

rh.docs: Set height relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's height, and 1 is 100% of parent's component height.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage of how tall relative to parent component.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

rh.docs: Set height relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's height, and 1 is 100% of parent's component height.

xy.docs: Set X and Y in pixels relative to parent component.

rxy.docs: Set X and Y in pixels in percentage relative to parent component.

wh.docs: Set width and height in pixels.

rwh.docs: Set relative width and height in percentage relative to parent component.

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.docs: Horizontal and vertical anchor.

anchor.docs: Set horizontal and vertical alignment anchor.

parameters.name: anchorX
parameters.docs: Horizontal anchor.

parameters.name: anchorY
parameters.docs: Vertical anchor.

anchor.docs: Set horizontal and vertical alignment anchor.

mchorse.mappet.client.gui.utils.graphics.name: Graphic
mchorse.mappet.client.gui.utils.graphics.docs:
Graphic element.

This is a base interface for all graphic elements that are being constructed by {@link UIGraphicsComponent}. Besides storing extra information per a type of graphic, every graphic has position and relative measurements (just like {@link UIComponent} has).

x.docs: Set X in pixels relative to parent component.

rx.docs: Set X relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully left, and 1 is fully right.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage how far into X.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

rx.docs: Set X relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully left, and 1 is fully right.

y.docs: Set Y in pixels relative to parent component.

ry.docs: Set Y relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully top, and 1 is fully bottom.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage how far into Y.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

ry.docs: Set Y relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is fully top, and 1 is fully bottom.

rw.docs: Set width relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's width, and 1 is 100% of parent's component width.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage of how wide relative to parent component.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

rw.docs: Set width relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's width, and 1 is 100% of parent's component width.

rh.docs: Set height relative in percents to parent component. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's height, and 1 is 100% of parent's component height.

parameters.name: value
parameters.docs: Percentage of how tall relative to parent component.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.docs: Offset in pixels (can be negative).

rh.docs: Set height relative in percents to parent component with offset. Passed value should be 0..1, where 0 is element will be 0% of parent component's height, and 1 is 100% of parent's component height.

xy.docs: Set X and Y in pixels relative to parent component.

rxy.docs: Set X and Y in pixels in percentage relative to parent component.

wh.docs: Set width and height in pixels.

rwh.docs: Set relative width and height in percentage relative to parent component.

anchor.docs: Set both X and Y anchor point of this graphic object.
Set X and Y anchor point of this graphic object individually.

parameters.name: x
parameters.docs: A factor 0..1, where 0 is the left edge, 1 is the right edge.

anchorX.docs: Set X anchor point of this graphic object.

parameters.name: y
parameters.docs: A factor 0..1, where 0 is the top edge, 1 is the bottom edge.

anchorY.docs: Set Y anchor point of this graphic object.

hoverOnly.docs: Set this graphic to display only when when mouse is over it.
